div.l: Whan folk han laughen at this nyce cas
Of absolon and hendy Nicholas
Diủerse folk diủersly they seide
But for the more part thei loghe and pleide
Ne at this tale y sagh no man him greue
But it were oonly Oswolde the Reue
By cause he was of Carpentrs crafte
A litel Ire is in his herte lafte
He gan to grocche and blamed it a lite
So theyk quod he ful wel y kuo koude kuokoude you quyte
With bleryng of a proude myllers eye
If that me list speke of Rybaudrye
But ik am olde me list not pleie for age
Gras tyme is passed my foddre is now forage
This white top̄pe writeth myn olde yeres
Myn hert is also mowled as myne heres
But if y fare as doth an openers
That ilke fruyt is eủere lenger the wers
Til hit be roten in mullok or in stree
We olde men y drede so fare we
Til we be roten kon we notht be ripe
We hoppe al way whil that the world wol pipe
For in oure wil ther steketh eủere a naal
To han an hore hede and a greene tail
As hath a leke for thogh oure myght be gon
Oure wil desireth foly euer in on
For wan we may noght doon than we speke
Yit in oure asshen colde is fyre y reke
Foure gledes han we which y shal deuyse
Auantyng lyyng anger and Couetise
Thise foure sparkes longen vn to elde
Oure olde lymes mowe wel been vnwelde
But wille ne shal noght faillen that is sooth
And yit haue y al way a coltes tooth
